intro: Blakea bocatorena, commonly known as the Bocatorena waxplant, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its glossy, waxy leaves and clusters of small, fragrant yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
